unit_learning_outcomes.description: Analyse and evaluate change processes and impediments to change.
Apply self-management techniques to address challenges and goals.
Identify and explain key concepts and theories in leadership.
Formulate a leadership style and plans.

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to BBusLeadCom and 50cp at 1000 level or above including BBA102 or MGMT1002

assessments.description: This 1,500 word essay assists students in developing their knowledge of leadership, leaders and assessing their own leadership style.

Students will discuss Self-Management and/or leadership techniques that they have employed or are planning to put in place for themselves and in respect to their future leadership style. This will be done via a video presentation.

Students will reflect on their own personal journey (past, present or future) and discuss their self-reflection in respect to weekly lecture content. Two personal journal entries are required (15% each entry).

data.unit_offering_text:
*

* This unit offering is subject to a quota. Limited places are available. Please refer to the Faculty for further information.
data.description: Leadership begins with knowing who you are. In this unit, students will be introduced to tools for self-reflection. Students will examine methods, skills, and strategies that will help them achieve career objectives. This unit also examines leadership theories, traits and behaviours and will provide students with discipline specific knowledge and skills, as well as the opportunity to conduct a comprehensive self-analysis. Outcomes from this unit will help students understand themselves and the foundations of leadership.
data.title: Leading Self
